title: Simple Planning Tool expanded to Louisiana
content:
Cover image of the Simple Planning Tool presentation. Credit: NOAA SCIPP
Cover image of the Simple Planning Tool presentation. Credit: NOAA SCIPP
The Southern Climate Impacts Planning Program (SCIPP), a NOAA Climate Adaptation Partnerships team, is happy to announce the release of the Simple Planning Tool for Louisiana Climate Hazards. The tool is now available for all states in the SCIPP region: Oklahoma, Arkansas, Texas, and Louisiana. The Simple Planning Tool assists planners, emergency managers, and decision makers in Louisiana who are assessing their long-term climate risks, both historically and in the future. The tool was primarily designed for decision makers who serve small- to medium-sized communities but may also be of interest to those who serve larger areas. The tool is now available on SCIPP's website.
